title: Land resource economics 1
overview: This course provides fundamental knowledge about economics in the use and management of land resources. It covers the characteristics of land resources and economic issues related to them. The course includes knowledge about soil fertility, the nature and relationships of land rent in land use, absolute and comparative advantages, and opportunity costs in land resource use. The course is taught using a combination of lectures and seminars.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Understanding the scientific nature of land economics
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will understand the fundamental concepts of land economics.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Analyzing economic relationships in land management and use
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to analyze economic relationships in land management and use.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Collecting information and evaluating land use efficiency
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will develop skills in collecting information and evaluating land use efficiency.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Understanding social context and professional ethics
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will gain an understanding of the social context and professional ethics.
Students will be equipped with the ability to self-learn and accumulate experience to enhance their expertise in land economics.
